title: Mumbai BMC election results 2026: Uddhav Thackeray's Shiv Sena's 30-year control collapses
content: Early trends indicate the Mahayuti alliance, led by BJP and Eknath Shinde's Shiv Sena, is poised to end the Shiv Sena (UBT)'s 30-year dominance in the BMC. The alliance is leading in over 110 wards, with BJP showing significant strength. Similar trends are observed in Pune, where BJP is displacing the Pawars.

title: India gets its 92nd GM: No coach, single father’s grind, and a dream vs Gukesh
content: Aaryan Varshney became India’s 92nd chess Grandmaster at 21, guided entirely by his father Gaurav, a single parent since Aaryan was five. With no coach, academies, or foreign training, Gaurav trained him at home using game analysis and ChessBase. Overcoming pandemic hurdles, Aaryan rose rapidly and now dreams of becoming a World Champion.

title: AI will destroy your business: Mark Cuban's stark warning
content: Billionaire Mark Cuban issues a stark warning: businesses must master AI or face failure. He emphasizes understanding AI's nuances, not treating it as interchangeable. Cuban likens AI to a savant remembering everything but lacking true understanding. He also highlights critical intellectual property risks, stating data is now more valuable than gold, urging companies to protect their information from AI harvesting.

title: $180bn and counting: Why US arms Israel like no other; the ultimate defence pact decoded
content: Israel's decades-long deep reliance on US military, diplomatic, and political backing is being re-examined. Prime Minister Netanyahu's call to taper US aid to zero within a decade signals a shift towards strategic self-reliance, amidst growing US involvement in Israel's war decisions and evolving American public opinion.

title: Maha civic polls: Mahayuti surge dents Thackeray camps; Cong falters - highlights
content: The Mahayuti alliance, comprising BJP and Shiv Sena, has secured a dominant performance in Maharashtra's local body elections, leading in key municipal corporations including Mumbai, Pune, and Nagpur. This victory is being hailed as a mandate for Prime Minister Modi's policies and nationalism, with opposition parties like Shiv Sena (UBT), NCP, and Congress facing significant setbacks.

title: Zuckerberg hired Wang for $14bn, now they're clashing
content: Meta's new structure reveals tension between Mark Zuckerberg and Alexandr Wang, the $14 billion AI recruit. Wang finds Zuckerberg's micromanagement stifling, while staff question his leadership for Meta's AI ambitions. A recent strategy clash highlighted differing priorities, with Wang pushing for cutting-edge AI over immediate product integration.

title: Iran hangs wrestler Navid Afkari at 27 despite Trump pleas
content: Navid Afkari was a rising Iranian wrestler who joined 2018 protests and was later executed in 2020. He denied the charges and said he was tortured. Amnesty International and the United Nations criticized the trial. Despite appeals from Donald Trump and Dana White, Iran carried out the execution, turning Afkari into a symbol of protest and fear.

title: ‘Short on cricket’: India coach explains Rohit's quiet ODI run amid Kohli surge
content: While Virat Kohli shines with consecutive fifties, Rohit Sharma faces scrutiny in the ongoing ODI series. Assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate attributes Sharma's recent modest scores to challenging pitch conditions and a lack of recent match practice, emphasising his team-first approach and overall strong ODI record.

title: Capital chokes: GRAP-III reimposed in Delhi-NCR; air quality likely to turn 'severe'
content: Delhi-NCR faces renewed pollution crisis as authorities re-implement GRAP-III restrictions. Non-essential construction, demolition, and mining activities are halted. Vehicular curbs target older diesel and petrol models. Essential services and critical projects are exempted, with schools offering hybrid learning. This move aims to combat the 'severe' air quality forecast.

title: OpenAI's IPO: Market commentator warns of risk, says Musk's lawsuit 'not good one'
content: Elon Musk's lawsuit against OpenAI, alleging a departure from its non-profit mission for commercial gain, is heading to trial this spring. Market commentator Jim Cramer believes this legal battle could significantly impact OpenAI's future public offering.  Musk claims the company, particularly its partnership with Microsoft, has betrayed its founding principles.

title: ‘Leave by any means available’: India keeps close watch on Iran amid escalating tensions
content: The Ministry of External Affairs has urged around 9,000 Indian citizens, primarily students in Iran, to depart the country due to recent developments. Advisories have been issued for both those in Iran and those planning to travel there. India is actively monitoring the situation and preparing to assist citizens wishing to return home.

title: Latur: Cong wins LMC polls with 43 of 70 seats; BJP settles for 22
content: Congress is leading in the Latur Municipal Corporation elections, ahead of the BJP in early trends. This closely watched contest unfolds amidst Maharashtra's ongoing civic polls, where the ruling alliance has shown strong performance. The LMC results follow a tight race in 2017, with the BJP then emerging as the largest party.

title: Stock market open on Sunday for Budget 2026! BSE, NSE release schedule for Feb 1 - see details
content: Stock markets will observe a rare Sunday trading session on February 1, allowing investors immediate reaction to the Union Budget 2026-27. Both BSE and NSE announced full-day trading, with pre-open from 9 am to 9:08 am and regular trading from 9:15 am to 3:30 pm.

title: BMC results: BJP trolls Raj Thackeray with 'rasmalai'; Mahayuti sweeps polls
content: In a light-hearted twist following the BJP's victory in the Maharashtra civic elections, MP PC Mohan cheekily took a dig at Raj Thackeray by referencing 'rajmalai'. This comes on the heels of Thackeray’s playful jab at K Annamalai, calling him 'rasmalai' during a spirited debate on Mumbai's essence.

title: Mustafizur row: 'I've received death threats'- Bangladesh players' chief speaks out
content: Bangladesh Cricketers’ Welfare Association president Mohammad Mithun faces death threats after advocating for players subjected to derogatory remarks.  He insists his actions are solely for player welfare, especially with the T20 World Cup approaching.  Mithun expressed shock at the threats, emphasizing his commitment to player rights and national interest, not politics.

title: Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt's heartfelt life update amid team's tough season
content: The Kansas City Chiefs had a pretty disappointing season this time, but the billionaire heiress, Gracie Hunt, has always been there for the team. Amid all the mess, Gracie Hunt has made a wholesome post about her life along with a few inspirational words that has moved fans. With the team's poor performance, many of their players are also getting trolled brutally.

title: 'Ramayana is Hindu, I'm...': AR Rahman on doing music for Ranbir Kapoor, Sai Pallavi starreer
content: AR Rahman discusses his collaboration with Hans Zimmer for Nitesh Tiwari's 'Ramayana,' highlighting his respect for Hindu mythology despite being Muslim. He emphasizes the epic's moral core and the importance of seeking wisdom universally. Rahman sees the project as a global message of love, uniting diverse backgrounds.

title: Watch: Dramatic video shows IDF Black Hawk crashing after harness tore mid-lift; no injuries reported
content: A Black Hawk helicopter, known as the Yanshuf, crashed while being airlifted after an emergency landing earlier this week due to severe weather in Gush Etzion. The harness reportedly tore mid-lift, causing the helicopter to fall near a house. No injuries were reported, and an investigation has been ordered.

title: The Butterfly Effect: How Oct 7 made America the world's 'daddy'
content: That day, a terrorist organisation’s desire to imbibe a little culture by paragliding into a music festival ended up rewriting the world order. The story that followed could have been directed by Quentin Tarantino: gory, non-linear, with all threads interconnected and a few perverts thrown in. Israel’s furious response, with help from Uncle Sam, led to the dismantling of Iran’s Axis of Resistance, tangentially hastened Trump’s return to the White House, and reminded Russia, China, and even Europe who is Daddy.

title: PCMC election results: Pawars fail to deliver in Pimpri-Chinchwad, Pune; BJP takes major lead
content: The Nationalist Congress Party, split into factions led by Ajit Pawar and Sharad Pawar, faced a significant setback in the Pimpri-Chinchwad and Pune municipal elections. Despite campaigning together, both factions suffered losses, with the BJP leading in a majority of wards. This performance raises questions about the potential merger of the NCP factions.

title: Jalna civic polls: Gauri Lankesh murder accused Shrikant Pangarkar celebrates victory
content: In an unexpected political victory, Shrikant Pangarkar, a figure entwined in the Gauri Lankesh murder case, has declared independence triumphantly by winning a seat on the Jalna Municipal Corporation. Freshly released on bail, he previously attempted to align with the Shiv Sena, but that affiliation was cut short.

title: Gold price today: How much 22K, 24K gold cost in Delhi, Mumbai & other cities – Check rates
content: Gold prices experienced a slight dip in domestic markets on Friday as profit-taking emerged after international bullion retreated from record highs. A firmer US dollar contributed to the decline in overseas trade. While most major Indian cities saw a marginal increase in gold prices, Chennai recorded a decrease.

title: 'Why does this happen?': Ashwin questions Arshdeep exclusion under Gambhir
content: Veteran spinner Ravichandran Ashwin has voiced strong criticism of the team management's handling of Arshdeep Singh, who has been overlooked for the first two ODIs against New Zealand. Ashwin emphasized the detrimental impact on a player's confidence and argued Arshdeep's consistent performances warrant automatic selection, questioning the logic of his late inclusion.

title: How speed, skill, & science saved Mumbai man from major stroke, triggered by neck pain
content: A Mumbai man's life was saved after a sudden stroke, thanks to his wife's quick thinking and a hospital team's swift intervention. Arriving within the critical 20-minute window, doctors successfully removed a blockage in his brain artery, restoring blood flow and reversing severe symptoms. This case highlights the vital importance of rapid medical attention for stroke victims.

title: 'Little bit of hate': Chahal reveals life after divorce from Dhanashree
content: Indian spinner Yuzvendra Chahal says his divorce from Dhanashree Verma is a closed chapter, emotionally settled once legal proceedings ended. Choosing peace over bitterness, he says both have moved on happily. Unfazed by rumours, dating speculation, or online trolling, Chahal focuses on personal growth, maturity, and moving forward without resentment.

title: What makes a neighbourhood good for living? 6 things to look for before buying a property
content: Choosing a home involves more than just the property itself; the neighborhood significantly impacts daily life and investment value. Key factors to consider include accessibility to work and amenities, safety and security, environmental cleanliness, community feel, and future growth potential. A well-chosen locale ensures comfort and happiness, making it a wise long-term decision.

title: Raped as minor & killed at 18: Diary helps Delhi cops nab relative
content: Seven months after an 18-year-old girl's murder, police apprehended a relative for alleged sexual assault during her childhood. The diary entry revealed the abuse, which occurred when the accused was also a minor. Separately, the girl's classmate confessed to her murder, claiming she attacked him first. The victim's father alleged ongoing harassment.

title: Where is Riyan Parag? Inside details of all-rounder's recovery at BCCI CoE - exclusive
content: Riyan Parag, one of the early picks in Gautam Gambhir’s coaching era, is nearing full fitness after a shoulder injury layoff. Currently training at the BCCI’s Centre of Excellence, the all-rounder has resumed full-intensity bowling and batting. With injuries hitting India’s white-ball setup, Parag could re-enter contention pending clearance.

title: Kohli on top: ICC corrects ranking error after backlash; India great moves to all-time third
content: Virat Kohli's return to the No. 1 ODI batting ranking was marred by an ICC error regarding his days at the top. Initially stated as 825 days, the figure was corrected to 1,547 days, placing him third all-time and first among Indians. This correction followed a backlash from fans and statisticians.

title: Skip Bayless accuses LeBron James of trying to push Austin Reaves out
content: LeBron James' agent, Rich Paul, sparked controversy by suggesting a trade for Austin Reaves, a move James denies involvement in. Despite James' insistence, analysts like Skip Bayless question his influence, citing past patterns. Meanwhile, the Lakers grapple with defensive issues as Reaves, sidelined by injury, remains engaged with the team.

title: US visa: Faster interview slots in some Indian cities; Mumbai, Delhi wait times inside
content: US visa interview wait times for Indian applicants show significant variation across cities and visa types. While Hyderabad and Kolkata offer faster appointments for visitor visas, Mumbai and New Delhi face longer delays. Student visa processing is generally quicker, with New Delhi providing the earliest slots. Employment visa availability also differs, with Mumbai showing the shortest wait.

title: Bahu is a relative, but not by SEBI definition? The takeover rule dilemma & the need for reforms
content: Under current SEBI takeover regulations, the term ‘immediate relatives’ is limited to spouses, parents, siblings, and children. Notably, sons-in-law and daughters-in-law are excluded from this definition

title: Australian wakes up to python curled up on her chest — how it happened
content: A Brisbane woman woke up to a shock finding a large carpet python on her bed. The snake had apparently entered her second-storey home through an open window. Snake activity is high due to breeding season and warmer weather. Experts advise against approaching snakes and recommend calling professionals for removal.

title: Looking beyond oil trade: Russia eyes joint ventures with India
content: Indo-Russian dies to deepen? Russia is ramping up efforts to deepen non-energy economic ties with India, with firms exploring localisation across sectors such as engineering, shipbuilding, IT, renewables and metallurgy.

title: ‘This time bullet won’t miss target’: Iran airs clip of Trump's 2024 assassination attempt
content: Iranian state television aired footage showing a threat against US President Donald Trump, displaying a placard with his image and a message implying a failed assassination attempt. This direct threat follows Trump's warnings of military action against Iran amid ongoing anti-government protests and previous Iranian plots against him.

title: Priya Kapur goes to SC to seek Sunjay, Karisma divorce papers, amidst Rs 30,000 cr inheritence feud
content: A legal battle is escalating over businessman Sunjay Kapur's estate following his June 2025 demise. His children with Karisma Kapoor allege his widow, Priya Sachdev Kapur, forged his will. The dispute has now reached the Supreme Court, with Priya seeking divorce case documents from Sunjay and Karisma's 2016 separation.

title: Blood test at Rs 7, ECG at Rs 25: Inside Khan Sir’s low-cost hospital in Patna
content: Inspired by his mother's vision, Khan Sir is launching affordable hospitals in Patna, offering services like blood tests for Rs 7 and ECGs for Rs 25. His initiative aims to make healthcare accessible, with treatments reportedly cheaper than government facilities. The hospital will feature a blood bank, cancer treatment, and advanced dialysis, prioritizing hygiene with unique anti-infection operation theatre mats.

title: Stock market today: Which stocks are the biggest gainers and losers on NSE, BSE today?
content: Indian stock markets opened strong on Friday. Nifty50 and Sensex saw significant gains before paring some of their advances. Investors are adopting a cautious approach. Hopes for India-EU and India-US trade deals are boosting sentiment. Several major companies are set to announce their Q3 earnings today.

title: Twenty20 signals major strategy shift, open doors to potential alliance with fronts in Assembly polls
content: Sabu M. Jacob, chief coordinator of the party, says no front will be considered untouchable as long as an ideal alliance deal that allows the outfit to retain its identity is on the table

title: Jagan condemns murder of YSRCP activist in Palnadu district
content: The murder reflects the growing intolerance and political vendetta being unleashed by the TDP leaders, the YSRCP chief alleges, and says that law and order has deteriorated in the State

title: Excessive dependence on AI could erode higher-order thinking: AI expert-educator Clif Kussmaul
content: Addressing widespread fears about job losses, the expert opined that history shows new technologies tend to expand human work rather than eliminate it.

title: After two years of including transgenders in OBC quota, Rajasthan jobs data shows none selected
content: The data submitted by the State to the HC shows that out of 91 transgender applicants in these two years, the maximum of 39 belonged to the General category, 19 to Scheduled Tribes, 22 to OBCs, seven to Scheduled Castes, and four to EWS communities

title: HRDA opposes move to dilute Convener Quota in medical admissions
content: The push by the managements of private medical colleges for uniform fees was not a benign reform but a strategic attempt to eliminate affordable Convener Quota seats and transform merit-based medical education into a privilege accessible only to affluent students, the association said

title: GRAP 3 curbs enforced in Delhi-NCR as air quality ‘very poor’; likely to turn 'severe'
content: Unfavourable meteorological conditions, along with vehicular emissions, stubble burning, firecrackers and other local pollution sources often push air quality in Delhi-NCR to hazardous levels

title: Nearly 44,000 startups registered in 2025, highest since the launch of Startup India: PM Modi
content: The Prime Minister, speaking on the 10th anniversary of Startup India, said that there are now more than 2 lakh startups across the country and around 125 unicorns.

title: Kerala improves rankings from 19 to 11 in NITI Aayog’s export preparedness index
content: The State’s well-diversified export basket reaches over 100 countries, with strong West Asian linkages supported by its large diaspora, according to the report.

title: Hot air balloon show draws huge crowds on opening day at Parade Grounds in Secunderabad
content: The balloons at Parade Grounds were permitted to rise only vertically to an altitude of about 50 feet, remain airborne for approximately seven minutes

title: Simulator-based cardiology training programme under way at SCTIMST
content: With technology and AI now driving vast areas of diagnostics and cardiac interventions, training the next generation cardiologists with the latest in imaging and simulation has become an imperative.

title: No Nipah virus case in Tripura: Official
content: Mission Director, National Health Mission (NHM), Saju Waheed A, said the government is serious about preventing the disease and has taken multiple measures

title: PM Modi to visit Bengal, Assam on January 17, 18; will flag off first Vande Bharat sleeper train
content: This will be the prime minister’s second visit to Bengal amid the ongoing SIR exercise and his first since the political firestorm triggered by the ED's searches at I-PAC offices on January 8

title: Survey challenges online ‘stranger danger’, finds young people fear unwanted contact from known persons more
content: While 77.9% of respondents reported household-level smartphone access, access to computers or laptops showed a stark urban-rural divide

title: Maharashtra Civic polls: BJP leads on 84 seats in Nagpur, Congress 41, and AIMIM 4
content: The AIMIM contested on 6 seats in Nagpur, where party chief and Lok Sabha MP Assuddin Owaisi addressed a rally during campaigning

title: Centre has given in‑principle nod for Hyderabad Metro Rail Phase II, says Union Minister
content: The Centre is now awaiting for Telangana Government to nominate two officials for Joint Committee, Union Housing and Urban Affairs Minister Manohar Lal Khattar is said to have told Union Minister Kishan Reddy

title: Maharashtra civic polls: BJP takes lead in Pune bastion of Ajit and Sharad Pawar
content: The BJP has won 29 electoral wards and is leading in 43 others in Pune, as per the data shared by the election department of the civic body

title: In Pictures: Bravehearts in pursuit of raging 'jallikattu' bulls
content: This is a compilation of photographs that capture moments from the traditional bull-taming sport of 'jallikattu' conducted in various parts of Tamil Nadu this season in 2026

title: Maharashtra civic poll results: Congress sweeps Latur Municipal Corporation with 43 seats
content: Local political observers believe Maharashtra BJP president Ravindra Chavan's controversial remarks on Congress stalwart and late CM Vilasrao Deshmukh, who hailed from Latur, backfired

title: ‘Andhra Jallikattu’ draws hundreds of youth near Tirupati
content: The cattle festival, a three-century-old tradition in Chandragiri mandal, differs from Tamil Nadu’s Jallikattu, and the event is organized purely as a cultural celebration without betting or prize money, organisers said

title: Thiruvalluvar Day: T.N. CM Stalin presents awards to eminent personalities
content: Mr. Stalin presented the Ayyan Thiruvalluvar Award for 2026 to scholar M.P. Sathiyavel Muruganar and the Perarignar Anna Award for 2025 to DMK general secretary and Minister Duraimurugan

title: Fire-hit Goa nightclub operated under different names, probe to cover violations since 1999: CM Sawant
content: Leader of Opposition Yuri Alemao demanded that the government provide data on establishments that have violated the Coastal Regulation Zone (CRZ) laws

title: Gauri Lankesh murder case accused wins Jalna civic poll as Independent
content: Pangarkar had contested as an Independent candidate from electoral ward No. 13. He defeated his nearest rival, Raosaheb Dhoble of the BJP

title: Kozhikode railway station redevelopment ‘dragging’
content: Only 18% of the work completed so far. Originally scheduled for completion by December 2026, the project had now been pushed to mid-2027

title: BJD’s ‘internal unease’ surfaces after suspensions of 2 MLAs
content: The suspensions appeared to have been driven by fear within the BJD, which is deeply worried about the formation of a new political party that could grow at its expense, says Rabi Das, a veteran political analyst

title: NEET aspirant death case: Prashant Kishor meets bereaved family members of student
content: The 18-year-old aspirant and a resident of Jehanabad was found unconscious in her hostel room under the Chitragupt Nagar police station area earlier this month and died during treatment at a private hospital

title: House surgeon at government hospital in Thanjavur booked under POCSO Act
content: According to the police, a few days ago, the accused, who was on night duty, allegedly attempted to molest a 15-year-old girl who was staying at the hospital to take care of her relative

title: Mortar shell found in Jammu & Kashmir's Baramulla; defused
content: “The shell was safely disposed of by an Army bomb disposal squad in the presence of police,” officials said

title: Elderly woman living alone found murdered in Bedadka; police confirm well-planned crime, robbery angle being probed
content: The 72-year-old lived alone in a small sheet roofed house in an isolated area with very few neighbouring homes

title: Dodgers strike again, land Tucker, sources say
content: The World Series champion Dodgers added another big bat to an already-potent lineup Thursday night, agreeing to a four-year, $240 million deal with prized free agent Kyle Tucker, sources told ESPN.

title: Dozens charged with college hoops point shaving
content: A college basketball point-shaving scheme involving more than 39 players on 17 teams resulted in dozens of games in the previous two seasons being fixed by a gambling ring that included a former NBA player, according to a federal indictment.

title: Warriors prove Kuminga 'not a distraction' in win
content: The Warriors kept their focus on the court, saying the talk of Jonathan Kuminga's trade demand was "not a distraction" in Thursday's win over the Knicks.

title: Darnold expects to play despite new oblique injury
content: Sam Darnold expects to play Saturday in the team's divisional round playoff game against the 49ers despite being added to the injury report Thursday with an oblique injury.

title: Vandy LB among 5 denied injunction for 5th year
content: Five college football players seeking to play a fifth season this fall had their motions for a preliminary injunction denied Thursday by a federal judge.

title: Philly GM: 'Hard to find great players' like Brown
content: Eagles GM Howie Roseman said players such as A.J. Brown are in short supply when asked if he would be open to trading the star wide receiver this offseason.

title: Oklahoma QB Mateer, LB Lewis to return in '26
content: Oklahoma quarterback John Mateer and linebacker Kip Lewis will return in 2026, the school announced on Thursday.

title: Nacua's brother won't be charged after taking car
content: Samson Nacua, the brother of Rams wide receiver Puka Nacua, will not be charged after he was arrested last month for allegedly taking a vehicle without the owner's consent, with investigators now telling ABC7 that they believe it was accidental.

title: 🏈 Kiper's Big Board: Ranking  NFL draft prospects
content: Mel Kiper Jr. is stacking the top 25 players for the NFL draft, starting with Fernando Mendoza. See who follows him after Dante Moore decided to return to school.

title: Inside Mike Tomlin's decision to walk away from the Steelers
content: 'It was dead silent' when the coach stunned the Steelers' locker room. Here's what we know about what's next.

title: Our guide to every NFL divisional round game: Previews, bold predictions and X factors
content: Bills-Broncos? 49ers-Seahawks? Texans-Patriots? Rams-Bears? We have picks, predictions and stats to know for the divisional round games.

title: How can four underdogs pull off upsets?
content: Could we see surprises? Let's find matchup advantages and X factors for the Bills, Bears, Texans and 49ers.

title: Giannis and the Bucks: Four possible pathways forward in Milwaukee at the deadline
content: The Bucks and Antetokounmpo currently sit in 11th place ahead of the trade deadline. What are their options?

title: CFP National Championship preview: Miami's path to knocking off Indiana
content: Will the Hoosiers cap an undefeated season, or can the Canes pull off a stunner? Here are the keys to the game.

title: Yates' debut rankings for the 2026 NFL draft: Ranking the top 25 prospects, plus scouting reports
content: Who are the best players in this year's NFL draft class? Which receivers have first-round talent? Field Yates stacks his top 25 board.

title: How Darnold-to-Smith-Njigba fuels Seahawks' playoff run
content: The duo connects to overcome past narratives, powers Seattle to home-field advantage in NFC divisional round.

title: How the Bears, Caleb Williams became an offensive juggernaut
content: Ben Johnson helped build one of the most explosive offenses in the NFL in Chicago. Here's how he did it.

title: Ranking the USMNT's top 15 prospects age 21 or younger, from Europe to MLS
content: As the USMNT's 2026 begins, we rank the U-21 American players on the national team radar. From Europe to MLS, here's the top 15.

title: 'This was too easy': Inside six college basketball games the feds allege were rigged
content: Prosecutors allege a gambling ring bribed 39 NCAA players to fix dozens of games. Here's a closer look at six games.

title: Rating Boozer, Dybantsa and 54 more freshmen
content: The 56 standouts, surprises and more of a historic freshman class, starting with Cameron Boozer and AJ Dybantsa.

title: ESPN's 2025 All-America team: The top players at every position
content: From Fernando Mendoza and Jeremiyah Love to Jacob Rodriguez and Rueben Bain Jr., here are the best of the best.

title: Solak: Hiring John Harbaugh is a massive win for the Giants -- even if it's no sure thing
content: The Giants are finalizing a deal for John Harbaugh to become their next coach. It has been a rough decade for New York, but this hire could finally turn the tide.

title: Kershaw, Verlander, Scherzer: Which pitcher is this generation's true ace?
content: Three future Hall of Famers have dominated the conversation. We break down who the king of the hill is for his generation.

title: How NFL players prepare for the coldest games of the year
content: Even as beards freeze and fingers lose feeling, NFL players find ways to handle ridiculously cold temperatures.

title: Who to bet to win Super Bowl 60: Our picks after one round of the playoffs
content: Who are we betting to win the Super Bowl? Our analysts broke down the odds and the team's performances to find answers.

title: Betting buzz: Any AFC team could go to the Super Bowl -- and the odds show it
content: One team could be one of the longest favorites, while another could be one of the shortest long shots.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United eye Hackney and Murillo, Maguire to leave?
content: Nottingham Forest center back Murillo and Middlesbrough midfielder Hayden Hackney are on Michael Carrick's shortlist at Manchester United. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Transfer window weekly: Güler to Arsenal? Guéhi to Man City?
content: The winter transfer window is open, so what are our reporters hearing about deals that could be done?

title: Weekend preview: Madrid seek redemption, Manchester derby, AFCON final
content: It's Friday and another full weekend of action awaits across the soccer calendar as Julien Laurens picks out the best games to watch in Europe.

title: Victor Wembanyama, Keldon Johnson shaved each other's heads following loss to OKC
content: Spurs center Victor Wembanyama and forward Keldon Johnson showed up to shoot around on Thursday with bald heads.

title: Fantasy baseball: Kyle Tucker's outlook rises with move to loaded Dodgers' lineup
content: Track all the latest MLB free agency and trade news with fantasy baseball analysis from Tristan H. Cockcroft and Eric Karabell.

title: Don't be surprised if ... Kon Knueppel leads the league in 3s made
content: Eric Karabell forecasts what to expect from notable players such as Kon Knueppel, Trae Young, Jalen Johnson and more.

title: "Unbelievably Embarrassing": Outrage Over Trump-Machado Nobel Row
content: Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado handed over her Nobel Peace Prize medal to Donald Trump during a meeting at the White House on Thursday, describing the gesture as "a recognition for his unique commitment with our freedom."

title: GRAP Stage-III Measures Enforced Across Delhi As Air Quality Worsens
content: Delhi's air quality situation has further deteriorated, raising concerns of an imminent shift into the 'Severe' category.

title: How Failed Thackeray Reunion May Have Cost 1 Cousin More Than The Other
content: Maharashtra's complicated political space took a turn ahead of the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation elections when estranged cousins Uddhav and Raj Thackeray joined forces after 20 years.

title: Probe Agency ED Files Chargesheet In Al Falah Money Laundering Case
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Friday filed a chargesheet in connection with a money laundering case involving the Al-Falah University in Faridabad, which was in the news last year as its professors were linked to the November Red Fort blasts.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Veto After Veto: How Congress, Now Caste Census Champion, Blocked Mandal Report For Years
content: Indira Gandhi was vetoed four times by her cabinet colleagues from implementing the Mandal Commission report, something that could have been a game-changer for the Congress.

title: Huge BMC Win For BJP And Allies, Thackerays Lose Grip On Richest Civic Body
content: The BJP-led alliance is headed to a massive victory in the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) elections as the Thackerays lose grip on Mumbai's civic body after 25 years, with votes still being counted in 29 civic bodies across Maharashtra.

title: Karisma Kapoor Calls Priya Kapur's Bid In Supreme Court To See Divorce Papers "Frivolous"
content: The Supreme Court on Friday told actor Karisma Kapoor to file her objections in two weeks on the maintainability of a fresh application submitted by Priya Kapur, seeking details of her divorce proceedings with late business tycoon Sunjay Kapur.

title: After Supreme Court, Jharkhand High Court Pauses Probe Against ED Officer
content: The Jharkhand High Court has paused a probe by Ranchi Police against Enforcement Directorate (ED) officers, a day after a similar move by the Supreme Court in a Kolkata Police case over the I-PAC office raids.

title: Uddhav Thackeray's Options After Losing Control Of Richest Civic Body BMC
content: Uddhav Thackeray may have lost control of the BMC amid a massive challenge from the BJP, but his position as a leader of consequence has remained intact with the Shiv Sena (UBT) winning 74 seats so far and outsmarting Eknath Shinde.

title: After BMC Drubbing, BJP Lobs Raj Thackeray's Rasmalai Dig Back At Him
content: Indulging in some sweet gloating after the BJP-Shiv Sena alliance crossed the halfway mark in leads in the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation elections, BJP leaders took swipes at MNS Chief Raj Thackeray, who had called K Annamalai 'rasmalai'.

title: NDTV Special: A Sneak Peek Inside India's First Vande Bharat Sleeper Trains
content: A landmark chapter for the Indian Railways is set to begin on January 17, when Prime Minister Narendra Modi flags off the nation's very first Vande Bharat Sleeper trains from Malda in West Bengal.

title: Putin Speaks To Israel, Iran Leaders, Says Russia Willing To Mediate
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin discussed the situation in Iran in separate calls on Friday with Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu and Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian, and said that Moscow was willing to mediate in the region, the Kremlin said.

title: BJP Repeats 2017 Performance On RSS Turf Nagpur, Deja Vu For Congress
content: The Bharatiya Janata Party is set for another sweeping victory in Nagpur, the turf of the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) - the BJP's ideological mentor.

title: What's Next For Raj Thackeray As Reunion Fails To Impress Mumbai Voters
content: For Raj Thackeray, who once mirrored the firebrand Bal Thackeray, survival has now become a hard bargain in Mumbai's evolving politics.

title: 750 Bulls, 500 Tamers Take Part In Trichy's Jallikattu, Winner To Get Car
content: The first Jallikattu event of the year and one of its most prominent traditional competitions was held in a grand manner at Periya Suryur in Trichy, Tamil Nadu.

title: Andhra Pradesh To Present Growth Story At Davos 2026
content: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu will head a high-level delegation to the World Economic Forum (WEF) Annual Meeting 2026.

title: Trump To Hold Off Attack On Iran For Now
content: President Donald Trump indicated that he might hold off on attacking Iran for now after saying he was reassured by sources "on the other side" that the government in Tehran would stop killing people involved in widespread protests.

title: Highway Blocked After Migrant Worker's Death Triggers Protests In Bengal
content: Beldanga in Bengal's Murshidabad became the epicentre of a major standoff on Friday, as heavy protests and roadblocks followed the alleged killing of a migrant worker in Jharkhand.

title: BMC Election Results LIVE: BJP-Shiv Sena Alliance Crosses Halfway Mark In Mumbai
content: BMC Election Results LIVE: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP)-led Mahayuti alliance is headed for a big victory in the state's municipal elections which were held on Thursday. Counting of votes started at 10 am Friday.

title: Only 20 Days Of Fuel Reserves Remain In Ukraine As Russia Strikes Continue
content: Ukraine has fuel reserves for more than 20 days, Energy Minister Denys Shmyhal told parliament, describing the overall energy situation in the country as very difficult following a series of Russian drone and missile attacks on power infrastructure.

title: Greenland is a territory of Denmark, says Russia, slams ‘double standards’ of Western powers
content: Moscow ⁠said this week that it was ‌unacceptable for ‌the West to keep claiming ‍that Russia and China ‍threatened Greenland, and said that the crisis over the territory showed the double standards ⁠of Western powers

title: Samajwadi Party slams U.P. government over demolition drive in Kashi's Dal Mandi area
content: The BJP, in its bid to favour its companions, is crushing every household and shopkeeper in Kashi's Dal Mandi. The public will not tolerate this oppression and injustice any longer, says Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav

title: BJP’s Ballari to Bengaluru padayatra in Karnataka stalled, pending approval from central party leadership
content: BJP is said to be wary of allowing Janardhan Reddy, who continues to face legal scrutiny in illegal mining cases, to project himself as a frontline leader through a high-profile padayatra

title: Supreme Court stays Mukul Roy’s disqualification from West Bengal Assembly
content: A Bench comprising Chief Justice Surya Kant and Justice Joymalya Bagchi stayed the November 13, 2025, order of the High Court

title: MSP guarantee law: Farmers’ awareness yatra from Kanyakumari to Kashmir from February 7
content: Kisan Morcha national co-convener and farmer leader Kurubur Shanthkumar said the 40-day yatra will start on February 7 at Kanyakumari with a demand for implementation of MSP for farm produce

title: Migrant workers being tortured for speaking Bengali in BJP-ruled states, alleges Mamata
content: Referring to a protest in Murshidabad's Beldanga over attacks on migrant workers outside West Bengal, she said the anger of the minority community was “legitimate”

title: Revenue Minister Krishna Byregowda fails to contain frustration over slow pace of highway bypass work in Hassan on Bengaluru-Mangaluru highway
content: The bypass is part of the four-lane National Highway 75 connecting Hassan and Maranahalli in Sakleshpur taluk

title: Nearly 44,000 startups registered in 2025, highest since the launch of Startup India: PM Modi
content: The Prime Minister, speaking on the 10th anniversary of Startup India, said that there are now more than 2 lakh startups across the country and around 125 unicorns.

title: CM Mamata protecting criminals, anarchists, she is close to bidding adieu to political career: Naqvi
content: BJP leader Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi said that despite all this, it is the responsibility of all political parties, constitutional institutions, and the Election Commission to ensure that West Bengal Assembly elections are held in a fair, fearless, and free environment.

title: Jharkhand High Court observes State police raid on ED office ‘pre-planned’
content: The Court ordered the Union Home Secretary to depute CRPF/BSF or any other paramilitary force to provide security to the ED office and its officers

title: Rajya Sabha Privileges panel to examine contempt of House complaint against Mamata Thakur, Mausam Noor
content: BJP’s Laxmikant Bajpai alleges that  TMC’s Mamata Thakur and former MP Mausam Noor made "unparliamentary utterances, created obstructions in the smooth functioning of the House...”

title: Vijay forms 10-member panel to steer TVK election campaign activities for Assembly poll
content: The committee will coordinate campaign meetings and other election-related activities across all 234 constituencies

title: Why participatory science is crucial to tackling coconut root wilt disease
content: Coconut palms that display tolerance under high inoculum pressure and intense vector load hold the key to combating phytoplasma

title: BJP to announce new party president on January 20
content: Polling will be held “if needed” on January 20 and an official announcement of the name of the new national president will be made the same day, said the party’s Rajya Sabha member K. Laxman

title: Two detained for ''involvement'' in Sundargarh clash; security tightened in Odisha
content: “The security has been strengthened in the Sundargarh district headquarters, and educational institutions, markets and public transport remained shut this morning,” a senior officer said

title: Nothing wrong in H.D. Kumaraswamy coming to State politics, says Karnataka BJP chief B.Y. Vijayendra
content: Mr. Vijayendra says the ‘former Chief Minister has uniquely contributed to the development of Karnataka’

title: Maharashtra civic polls: ECI ‘gaslighting’ citizens, says Rahul on indelible ink row; BJP counters with ‘khandani chor’ barb
content: The SEC, however, claimed that even if someone tried to vote again by removing the ink mark, it was not possible as other safeguards were in place

title: Supreme Court rejects Justice Varma’s challenge to ‘unilateral’ formation of inquiry panel by Speaker
content: A Bench headed by Justice Dipankar Datta rejected the petition filed by Justice Varma, anonymously identified as 'X' in the cause title, for lack of any merit

title: Second digital arrest scam in South Delhi in a week: Elderly businesswoman duped of ₹6.9 crore
content: According to police, the fraudsters placed Ms. Ahuja under continuous digital surveillance between January 5 and January 13 by posing as law enforcement and investigative authorities.

title: Modify injunction in Ilaiyaraaja personality rights suit, Sun TV urges Madras High Court
content: Justice Senthilkumar Ramamoorthy grants time till January 21 for the musician to respond to the modification application

title: Millet dishes take centre-stage at traditional food revival competition in Madikeri
content: Over 60 teams participated in the district-level competition, organized by the Kodagu district administration, Zilla Panchayat, and the Department of Agriculture at the office of the Joint Director of Agriculture in Madikeri

title: Anger, retaliation, vendetta dominates in India; forgiveness absent: Gopalkrishna Gandhi
content: Gopalkrishna Gandhi was speaking at the ongoing 19th edition of Jaipur Literature Festival on January 15

title: Minimum temperatures across Kashmir settle above seasonal average
content: The region, however, continued to experience sub-zero night temperatures, except in Kokernag, where the minimum settled above the freezing point

title: Airspace curbs at Delhi airport in relation to Republic Day
content: “Non-scheduled flights will not be allowed to take off or land at the airport from 8.30 a.m. to 1 p.m. and from 3 p.m. to 6 p.m. on January 26,” says official

title: Security forces fully prepared to tackle emerging challenges in J&K: Dulloo
content: The J&K Chief Secretary said multiple challenges persist, ranging from infiltration attempts to weather-related and terrain-specific difficulties, which are often exploited by adversarial elements

title: Unnao rape: Survivor moves Delhi HC to place more material in Kuldeep Sengar's appeal
content: In her application filed in the expelled BJP leader's appeal, she said she wanted to place before the court facts and documents to show "relevant recent developments" as well as the threat to herself and her family

title: Coast Guard seizes Pakistani boat with nine crew members for illegally entering Indian waters
content: The boat is being towed to Porbandar by an ICG ship for thorough “rummaging” and joint interrogation of the crew by agencies concerned

title: Noida schools up to Class 8 to remain closed on Jan 16, 17 due to cold
content: "All schools from Nursery to Class 8 affiliated with CBSE, ICSE, IB, UP Board, and other boards operating in Gautam Buddh Nagar district shall remain closed on January 16 and 17," says the order

title: Right to self-determination mustn’t be abused to encourage secession: India slams Pakistan at U.N.
content: Pakistan repeatedly raises the issue of Jammu and Kashmir at the United Nations and its various platforms but fails to get any traction from the wider international community on the matter

title: One more held for 'involvement' in bomb explosion at Manipur fuel station
content: “The 41-year-old accused was apprehended from the Lamphel Sana Keithel area in Imphal West district on January 16, and a cache of arms and ammunition was recovered from his possession,” says a senior officer

title: Meta, Amazon, Flipkart, Meesho fined for illegal walkie-talkie sales
content: Notices were issued to 13 e-commerce entities: Chimiya, JioMart, Talk Pro, Meesho, MaskMan Toys, TradeIndia, Antriksh Technologies, Vardaanmart, IndiaMart, Meta Platforms Inc. (Facebook Marketplace), Flipkart, Krishna Mart, and Amazon

title: Focused strategy to transform Andhra Pradesh into a knowledge hub, says CM Naidu
content: Emphasising tradition, the Chief Minister said Sankranti symbolises gratitude to elders and reverence for nature, while the harvest season reflects the prosperity of farmers.

title: Why is BMC result likely to get delayed today?
content: Mumbaikars voted on the 10,231 polling booths and cast their ballots to choose from the 1700 candidates in the fray

title: Zubeen Garg case: CM refuses to comment on Singapore court hearing; wife seeks truth through FB post
content: In a Facebook post, Garima Saikia Garg pledged the family's complete support to investigations, urged the Indian government to ‘monitor’ the proceedings in Singapore, and take all necessary diplomatic steps to ensure that every relevant fact is placed before it

title: 52.94% turnout recorded in Mumbai civic polls; down from 55.53% in last elections in 2017
content: The last BMC polls were held in 2017 with a voter turnout of 55.53%, and the term of the elected body ended in March 2022

title: Watch: How Nashik has thwarted the government’s plan to hack trees in Tapovan so far
content: Residents of Nashik are protesting against the proposed felling of trees at Tapovan, a site of deep historical, religious and ecological significance.

title: High-level panel formed to examine digital arrest issues: MHA tells SC
content: Earlier in December last year, the apex court had asked the CBI to carry out a unified pan-India probe into digital arrest scam cases. It had passed the directions in a suo motu case registered on the complaint of an elderly couple from Haryana

title: Suspect arrested for tearing banner and vandalism in temple in Puranapul in Hyderabad
content: A separate case was registered in connection with the attack on the police and the vandalism carried out by the mob

title: Delhi’s minimum temperature rises to 4.3°C as cold snap subsides
content: Safdarjung station’s 4.3°C was 3.3 notches below the normal. Palam recorded a minimum of 4.7°C, 2.8 notches below normal, while Lodhi Road logged 4.7°C, 1.3 notches below normal.

title: Pilots' body FIP serves legal notice to AAIB in relation to Ahmedabad plane crash probe
content: AAIB has summoned Captain Varun Anand, nephew of the late Sabharwal and a pilot of narrow-body aircraft with Air India

title: ₹4.71 lakh crore investment realised in 11 months: Karnataka Industries Minister M.B. Patil
content: State moving towards rapid progress following the Global Investors’ Meet, claims the minister who will be attending the World Economic Forum at Davos from January 19 to 23

title: Maharashtra civic election results LIVE: BJP achieves momentous victory in the State again, says CM Fadnavis
content: Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis calls Maharashtra BJP president Ravindra Chavan and Mumbai BJP president Ameet Satam to congratulate them as trends show the BJP leading in the municipal polls

title: Sri Siddaramanand Puri Swamiji laid to rest with state honours at Raichur’s Kanaka Guru Peetha ground
content: The Peethadhipathi of Kanaka Guru Peetha, Swamiji passed away in the early hours of Thursday (January 15, 2026)

title: Drones sighted along India-Pakistan border in J&K’s Poonch, Samba
content: The drones were seen hovering along the Line of Control (LoC) in Poonch and the Ramgarh sector of Samba district

title: Govt offices attacked during SIR hearings in West Bengal
content: After attack on the BDO office at Farakka in Murshidabad district on Wednesday, thousands of locals vandalised BDO office at Chakulia in Uttar Dinajpur district

title: Maharashtra civic polls: Young voters left confused over new alliances in Mumbai
content: Trends indicate the BJP has slowly increased its hold in the BMC, traditionally dominated by the Thackerays

title: Punjab CM Mann appears before Akal Takht Secretariat to clarify remarks on Sikh traditions
content: Before appearing before the Takht Secretariat, where he was present for more than an hour, Mr. Mann offered prayers at the Golden Temple

title: 2026 draft: Which underclassmen have declared?
